subject: The Calendar Is Shipping
event: Just got my big box of "author's copies" of the 2009 Ice and Fire calendar from the Dabel Brothers. Yes, I know, I'm prejudiced, but damn, this is gorgeous. Michael Komarck just keeps getting better and better. I hope all you guys remember him and the incredible work he did on this calendar when it comes time to nominate for the Hugoes. The calendar is shipping later than expected -- there was a delay with the art, and another with the printer -- but Les Dabel assures me that all the pre-orders are finally on the way. I can't explain the "out of stock" status of the calendar at Amazon, sorry. Very little of what Amazon does is comprehensible to me.

comments.article: Federal law dictates that product status as reported by Amazon.com must be entirely random.
Yup, they make up book publication dates all the time.
I wanted one of those calendars so much but the suckyness of the Aussie dollar puts it out of my price range :(

comments.upictitle: You'll have to speak up, I'm wearing a towel: iRaq
comments.article:
That's what friends and relatives are for - emotionally blackmailing into buying you ASOIAF calendars for Christmas!

That's what I did. It still only works out to about $23 Australian at the current rate, and about $31 with postage. So I think Mum knows she got off lightly this year. ;)
The funny thing is I put it on my Amazon Wish List earlier today. Now if I could only afford "The Art of..." book.
I have that book.. it is made of awesome.

comments.upictitle: You'll have to speak up, I'm wearing a towel: iRaq
comments.article: Good idea. I was planning on keeping the calendar anyway, but I might frame a couple too. Good luck choosing which ones not to frame, though. :/

I agree about Amazon. They won't sell some books in the U.S., but will overseas. (In my experience.) If in doubt, ask a publisher or author.

Merry Christmas to all... (Or whatever). Hope your holiday is full of light and meaning, joy and peace.

Thank you, George, for all your hard work.
comments.subject: Amazon is strange...

comments.article: OK so all I want for Christmas is Dinklage as Tyrion AND one of these calendars!!!

comments.upictitle: Kelly, Rayne, Hellion, Delectible Despot, pick one: idiots
comments.article:
No kidding! I ordered mine in the first week of October, and believed them when they said it would ship the week after Thanksgiving. I've sent a few Emails to Dabel, and have gotten NOTHING back (the first few were nice-- but after not even a form-letter reply from them, the last few have turned a bit scathing). Now I get to tell my SO "Sorry, honey. I ordered you the most awesomest thing in the world, and you're gonna LOVE it... iiiif it ever gets here. Happy Hannukah."

That's no way to do business.

Quote: "Very little of what Amazon does is comprehensible to me."

LOL!

The calendar is indeed beautiful. Maybe I'll order it....
The calender looks great. I think I now know what to give to my friend for Christmas.
Eeeeeeee! Hopefully I'll be getting one of these for christmas :)

I want a calendar but I am just reading the books so I do not want to see anything that might ruin the story.  Just finished Clash of Kings last night.  Next is Storm of Swords.  Theon Greyjoy...what a dick.

Theon Greyjoy...what a dick.

Hahahaa! Could be said about all the Greyjoys...and the Lannisters...mostly. ;)

i just ordered two! despite them being out of stock....
hopefully ill see them before the year is over, if not, ill just mail a couple of xmas gifts late. ;)

Dave and Dan should really talk to Michael Komarck about visual design for the HBO pilot. If sets and costuming were based of of his art work, the show couldn't help but have the feel of Westeros. If its something that Michael would be interested in.

I agree with this. He's got a great knack for capturing the setting and characters, and clearly does his research when it comes to things like armor and weapons. I think he could be a great addition to the conceptual design team.

Yeah we've been shipping these out like crazy.

Glad you liked them.

I'll ask Les to look into the amazon thing.


Derek @ DB
comments.subject: Calendars

comments.article:
I ordered mine through Amazon a while ago. And a few days ago they sent me a note saying "delivery estimate: January 27, 2009 - February 17, 2009"

/sigh

BUT At least we are getting them one of them was for my knight for Christmas. :D He will just get it late.

I love it. Thanks so much for doing this. The artwork is amazing and I cannot tell you how many hours we have spent discussing the books.

Marlene

Sweet!

I really wanted one of the highly artistic Game of Thrones RPG that Guardians of Order was putting out, but couldn't afford it.

I still have some of the RPG books with minor water damage available at half price, if that helps.

(I also have some with major water damage that would be much cheaper, but I wouldn't recommend those, they're pretty messed up).
comments.subject: Guardians of Order RPGs

comments.article:
So, I went to Amazon, and as always, they rolled out the red carpet for me. (I think they see me coming because I can't go there without buying something and they know it.)

So I ordered the calender a a few books and spent close to $70.

George, do you know your Hedge Knight #1 is "out of stock." I hate those words when I am looking for a book. I ordered it anyway and will see how long it takes to arrive. Maybe it will come with the marvelous calendar :)

"Dance, then, wherever you may be;
I am the Lord of the Dance, said he.
And Ill lead you all wherever you may be,
And Ill lead you all in the dance, said he."

I couldn't resist. I learned the song at Church Camp. Keep plugging away!!

BTW, I agree that the Giants seem to be falling apart, and you just don't know what you'll get on Sundays as far as the Jets are concerned.

Fandom aside, the Jets would be getting their just desserts if Pennington tears them up next week.

Merry Christmas,
Jamie
this bearded dude needs to take writing lessons from Terry Goodkind. I almost couldn't finish the fist page of this guys book.
comments.subject: I think

comments.article: Goodkind :: Martin : Meyers :: Rice
comments.subject: Re: I think

comments.article:
George, I am sure that since you just received it, I may get it in January, just not by Christmas. I ordered 2, which one is going to my friend as a belated Christmas present but enjoyed nonetheless.

Hello from Amazon.com.

Unfortunately, an unexpected delay from our supplier may prevent us from delivering some items in your order placed on December 02 2008 05:54 PST by December 24. We'll keep working to obtain these items for you, and we'll ship the items as soon as we receive them. Other items that may be in stock will still ship separately, with no increase in your total shipping charges.

George R.R. Martin, Michael Komarck "A Song of Ice and Fire 2009
Calendar" [Calendar]
Estimated arrival date: 01/27/2009 - 02/17/2009

If there are other items in your order, they'll be shipped according to the delivery estimates listed in the order details in "Your Account".

If you still want us to ship the delayed items when they do become available (though they may arrive later than expected) please visit this address to approve the delay:

http://www.amazon.com/gp/css/summary/edit.html/?

If you do not approve this delay by January 14 2009, we will cancel the item. However, if the item becomes available before that date, we will automatically ship it to you.

By approving the new delivery estimate, you are letting us know that you still want the item(s) though they may arrive after December 24. If we have not received your approval by January 14 2009 and the items are still not available, we will cancel them from your order.

We are sorry not to have met your expectations for this important order. We do value your business, and hope that you continue to favor Amazon.com for your online shopping needs.
comments.subject: I ordered it off amazon and they gave me a email explaining the situation (below)....

comments.article:
I ordered mine from the Dabel Brothers storefront back in October. It clearly stated that they would be available in December. So why would I then start bothering them about it for 2 months after I order it when they have already stated in the description about the due date. Yesterday 12/18 I have an email stating it has shipped. I will probably have it before Christmas, and most certainly before Jan 1st.
So why would you guys be ordering them from Amazon when DB is shipping now.
comments.subject: Mine has shipped

comments.article:
I ordered in early October from the Dabel Brothers website and other than the initial confirmation e-mail had not heard from them since then. But an e-mail arrived Tuesday evening stating that the Calendar had shipped via Ground and should take 5-7 days.

I was therefore quite surprised when I visited my P.O. Box today and found that it had already traveled from Georgia to California in just two business days (it was postmarked for the 17th). The package arrived in perfect condition and I am very satisfied.

The only thing that surprised me was that I had ordered a limited edition version for $24.99 and had expected the cover to be of Jon Snow, but there was an enclosed note saying that there had been a mistake in the solicitation and that Jon Snow cover was the regular cover. But the cover that I received, with Eddard Stark, looks very good too and the Jon Snow picture is still in the calendar elsewhere, so I don't mind. All of the pictures look great and while I was wary after reading some of the comments made here previously (I'm a longtime lurker) I can honestly say that I have no complaints whatsoever about this transaction.

Best of luck to everyone else with your orders!
comments.subject: I received mine

comments.article:
My father (in Florida) ordered a copy of the limited edition and got it yesterday. He was very impressed by the artwork and production values. Now he's got that to send to us, as well as a bunch of the Dark Sword Miniatures which didn't fit into the last package he sent us.

How we'reever going to piece those things together, much less paint them, we've no idea... Seeing them in real life makes you realzie just how absurdly tiny they are, and how absurdly talented the sculptors and painters must be who can work so much detail into such a small space.

Wow, those calendars are beautiful! It is nice to see dedication to ASOIF! But, I am a little put off with the "Sopranos" type ending to the series. I mean, just letting all those loose ends just hang... but it was still an exceptional quartet of books.

I think I want one of these calendars for the art work alone!
comments.subject: Just goind this blog!

comments.article: The series isnt over. I'm guessing you are joking right?
comments.subject: Re: Just goind this blog!

comments.article:
GRRM will pass away at the ripe old age of 92, just weeks after A Dance With Dragons is published. His dying words will be his expression of regret over never completeing his life long passion, editing the 23rd Wildcards book, titled Two Nines, a Deuce, a Four, and a Jack, the final book in the series.
I keed, i keed. Calendar looks great, and you are the best George.
